es.prodevelop.cit.gvsig.arcims.fmap.drivers
Interface ArcImsDriver

All Known Implementing Classes:
FMapFeatureArcImsDriver, FMapRasterArcImsDriver
public interface ArcImsDriver

This interface offers the functionality of an ArcIMS client.

Author:
jldominguez
See Also:
FMapRasterArcImsDriver

getCapabilities

void getCapabilities(java.net.URL server,
                     org.gvsig.remoteClient.wms.ICancellable cancel)
                     throws org.gvsig.remoteClient.arcims.exceptions.ArcImsException,
                            java.io.IOException,
                            java.net.ProtocolException
Gets the layers available on the server (the class that implements this interface will get the service name from the user)

Parameters:
server - ArcIMS server's URL
Throws:
org.gvsig.remoteClient.arcims.exceptions.ArcImsException

getMap

java.lang.Object getMap(org.gvsig.remoteClient.arcims.ArcImsStatus status)
                        throws org.gvsig.remoteClient.arcims.exceptions.ArcImsException,
                               java.io.IOException,
                               java.net.ProtocolException
Gets the visual information from the layers of the required service (that is, the map itself) depending on the graphic context (coord. system, view's size, etc)

Parameters:
status - the graphic context in which the request is performed
Returns:
the graphic data to be viewed, that is, the map
Throws:
org.gvsig.remoteClient.arcims.exceptions.ArcImsException
java.io.IOException
java.net.ProtocolException

getFeatureInfo

java.lang.String getFeatureInfo(org.gvsig.remoteClient.arcims.ArcImsStatus status,
                                int i,
                                int j,
                                int max_value)
                                throws org.gvsig.remoteClient.arcims.exceptions.ArcImsException,
                                       java.io.IOException,
                                       java.net.ProtocolException
Gets the layer's available information on a particular xy coordinates (usually derived from a mouse click). If it's a raster layer, a request will be sent to the server asking for the data associated to the elements (polygon, line or point) which cover the clicked pixel.

Parameters:
status - the graphic context in which the request is performed (ccord. system, view's dimension etc.)
i - x coordinate of the queried pixel
j - y coordinate of the queried pixel
max_value - maximun number of vector elements whose information will be retrieved.
Returns:
the available information at the given coordinates
Throws:
org.gvsig.remoteClient.arcims.exceptions.ArcImsException
java.io.IOException
java.net.ProtocolException
